audio_generation_params.text: Welcome to Advanced Machine Learning. I'm Dr. Sarah Chen, and I'll be guiding you through this comprehensive course on neural networks and deep learning.
In this first lesson, we'll explore the fundamentals of neural networks. We'll start with the basic building blocks and gradually build up to more complex architectures.

A neural network consists of layers of interconnected nodes, or neurons. Each connection has a weight that determines the strength of the signal. During training, these weights are adjusted to minimize the difference between predicted and actual outputs.
Now let's try an interactive exercise. You'll be able to adjust the weights and see how they affect the network's output in real-time.

Try changing the input values and observe how the network responds. Notice how the activation function transforms the weighted sum. This is the foundation of how neural networks learn patterns in data.
Great work! Now let's move to lesson two, where we'll explore backpropagation and gradient descent - the algorithms that make neural networks learn.

Backpropagation calculates how much each weight contributed to the error. We then use gradient descent to update the weights in the direction that reduces the error. This process repeats until the network converges to an optimal solution.

You've now completed the first module of our course. In the next session, we'll explore convolutional neural networks and their applications in computer vision. Don't forget to complete the quiz and practice exercises.
